title: Decentralized Learning Certificate Marketplace (Skill NFTs, Employer Verification, Portfolio Wallet)

requirements.text: Implement Internet Identity sign-in and role-aware navigation for two user types: Students (who earn/manage skill badges) and Employers (who verify student badges).

quotes: Decentralized Learning Certificate Marketplace... Features: Skill NFTs, Employer verification, Portfolio wallet

acceptanceCriteria: User can sign in using Internet Identity.
UI clearly offers entry points for Student and Employer flows after sign-in (e.g., tabs/pages), without requiring separate auth providers.
All user-facing text is in English.

requirements.text: Create backend data model and stable storage for on-chain skill badges ("Skill NFTs") issued to students, including: badge id, owner (Principal), skill name, issuer Principal, issue timestamp, optional metadata (description, level), and a verification status derived from stored data.

quotes: Students earn skill badges stored on blockchain.

acceptanceCriteria: Badges are stored persistently in the single Motoko actor (survive canister upgrades using stable variables or upgrade hooks).
Each badge is uniquely identifiable and linked to an owner Principal.
Backend exposes query methods to list badges by owner and to fetch a badge by id.

requirements.text: Add backend methods to issue (mint) a new skill badge to a student and to manage issuer permissions (who is allowed to mint), with safe defaults suitable for an MVP (e.g., canister controller/admin is initial issuer).

quotes: Students earn skill badges stored on blockchain.

acceptanceCriteria: Only authorized issuer(s) can mint new badges; unauthorized calls are rejected with a clear error.
Minting a badge records issuer Principal and issue timestamp.
A student can receive multiple badges; minting does not overwrite existing ones.

requirements.text: Build the Student Portfolio Wallet UI that allows a signed-in student to view, filter, and open details for their skill badges, and to share a verification link or code that employers can use to verify authenticity.
acceptanceCriteria: Student can see a list/grid of their badges loaded from the canister.
Student can open a badge detail view showing all stored metadata (skill name, issuer, issue time, id).
UI provides a shareable verification artifact (e.g., badge id and/or a copyable link containing the badge id) that an employer can use to verify.

requirements.text: Implement Employer Verification flow: a public/employer-accessible page where an employer can input a badge id (or open a shared link) and retrieve verification results from the canister, including whether the badge exists, its issuer, owner, and issuance timestamp.

quotes: Employer verification flow to validate authenticity of student skill certificates/NFTs

acceptanceCriteria: Employer can verify by entering a badge id and submitting.
If badge id is valid, the page displays verification details (exists, issuer Principal, owner Principal, issue timestamp, skill name).
If badge id is invalid/not found, the page shows a clear not-found state.
Verification uses only canister data (no external APIs).

requirements.text: Add a simple admin/issuer UI (accessible only to authorized issuers) to mint a skill badge to a specified student Principal, including form validation and success/error feedback.

quotes: Students earn skill badges stored on blockchain.

acceptanceCriteria: Issuer can input student Principal and badge fields (skill name, optional description/level) and mint successfully.
Unauthorized users cannot access mint UI and/or mint attempts fail with a clear error message.
After minting, the badge appears in the target studentâ€™s portfolio list when they load/refresh.

requirements.text: Apply a coherent visual theme for the app (distinct style, consistent typography, spacing, and components) appropriate for an education + credential marketplace; avoid blue/purple as primary brand colors.
acceptanceCriteria: All primary pages (Student Portfolio, Badge Detail, Employer Verification, Issuer Mint) share a consistent layout and component styling.
Primary color palette does not use blue/purple as the main brand colors.
UI uses Tailwind + existing UI components via composition (no edits to immutable UI component sources).

requirements.text: Generate and include static image assets for badge visuals and a simple app mark, store them under frontend/public/assets/generated, and use them in the UI (e.g., badge thumbnails and app header).
acceptanceCriteria: Generated images exist at frontend/public/assets/generated and are referenced directly by the frontend (not served from the backend).
Badge list shows a thumbnail/icon for each badge type (or a default badge image if no mapping).
App header/landing includes the generated app mark/logo.

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor with all logic in backend/main.mo (no additional backend services).
Use Internet Identity only for authentication (no third-party auth).
Do not modify files under frontend/src/components/ui or other immutablePaths; compose them from application code instead.
No external databases or third-party APIs for verification; all verification must come from canister state.
All user-facing text must be in English.
nonGoals: Implementing a full ICRC-7/ICRC NFT standard or marketplace trading mechanics (buy/sell/auctions/royalties).
Integrating external learning platforms (Coursera, Udemy, etc.) or importing certificates from third parties.
Real-time features (live chat, websockets) or push/email notifications.
AI/ML model hosting or inference features (the app may be themed for AI/ML skills but will not run models).

required: Minimal app mark/logo, academic + blockchain motif, flat vector style (app-mark.dim_512x512.png)
Set of 6 flat vector badge icons (e.g., chip, network, database, shield, brain, code) with consistent style and transparent background (badge-icons-set.dim_1024x1024.png)
Single generic badge card background texture/pattern, subtle, warm neutral palette (badge-card-bg.dim_1600x900.png)
